Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) directly convert fossil and/or renewable fuels into electricity and/or high-quality heat in an environmentally friendly way.
Titulo: An A-Site-Deficient Perovskite offers High Activity and Stability for Low-Temperature Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, high operating temperatures result in high cost and material issues, which have limited the commercialization of SOFCs.
Titulo: An A-Site-Deficient Perovskite offers High Activity and Stability for Low-Temperature Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To lower their operating temperatures, highly active and stable cathodes are required to maintain a reasonable power output.
Titulo: An A-Site-Deficient Perovskite offers High Activity and Stability for Low-Temperature Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here, we report a layer-structured A-site deficient perovskite Sr0.95Nb0.1Co0.9O3- (SNC0.95) prepared by solid-state reactions that shows not only high activity towards the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) at operating temperatures below 600 degrees C, but also offers excellent structural stability and compatibility, and improved CO2 resistivity.
Titulo: An A-Site-Deficient Perovskite offers High Activity and Stability for Low-Temperature Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: An anode-supported fuel cell with SNC0.95 cathode delivers a peak power density as high as 1016mWcm(-2) with an electrode-area-specific resistance of 0.052cm(2) at 500 degrees C.
Titulo: An A-Site-Deficient Perovskite offers High Activity and Stability for Low-Temperature Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells
